body:
For reference:

Ubuntu LTS (bionic): 3.6.5
Debian stable (stretch): 3.5.3
RHEL 8 (expected before v0.19): 3.6.x
Gentoo stable: 3.6.5
Arch: 3.7.1

Concept ACK. Release notes for 3.5 are here: https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.5.html . I think for this project, the most interesting new features could be:

- [Type hints](https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.5.html#whatsnew-pep-484)
- [Coroutines with async and await syntax](https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.5.html#whatsnew-pep-492)

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#15482](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/15482.html) (Implement BIPXXX's new softfork rules (The Great Consensus Cleanup) by TheBlueMatt)
* [#15437](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/15437.html) (p2p: Remove BIP61 reject messages by MarcoFalke)
* [#13541](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/13541.html) (wallet/rpc: sendrawtransaction maxfeerate by kallewoof)
* [#12911](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/12911.html) (wallet: Show fee in results for signrawtransaction* for segwit inputs by kallewoof)
* [#10443](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/10443.html) (Add fee_est tool for debugging fee estimation code by ryanofsky)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Concept ACK. 
+1 on being able to start using [Type Hints](https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.5.html#pep-484-type-hints).
@jnewbery You might be interested in reviewing this, since it removes some python2.7 leftovers from  "Remove Python2 support" in #11881

Looks good. I especially like _scripted-diff: test: Remove brackets after assert_  :100: Is there a flake warning we can add to enforce in that in future?

This is for inclusion in v0.19, so I'll review after v0.18 is forked.

tACK faa7cdf except PyEnv needs a full version number, i.e. `3.5.6`. With that, I was able to run `make check` and the functional test suite on macOS 10.14.3, but I didn't try the various linters and other tools.
utACK dddd1d0. Travis failure on `p2p_invalid_messages.py` seems spurious.

> Travis failure on p2p_invalid_messages.py seems spurious.

I restarted the job.

<!--a722867cd34abeea1fadc8d60700f111-->
